summary: Essex is a county in eastern England, bordering other counties like Cambridgeshire and Suffolk. It has a long coast along the North Sea and the Thames Estuary. The county town is Chelmsford, and the largest settlement is Southend-on-Sea. Essex has a mix of busy southern areas and rural landscapes. It includes ancient forests like Epping Forest and beautiful natural spots like Dedham Vale. Historically, it was home to the Trinovantes tribe and was later ruled by Romans, Saxons, and Vikings. Over time, Essex became linked to London's economy and developed coastal resorts and ports.
title: Essex
